revised_title: Assessing Imperfect Vaccines and Herd Immunity to HIV
tldr: This article discusses the impact of imperfect vaccines on herd immunity against HIV. The authors develop a mathematical model to compare different types of vaccine imperfections and their effects on the required vaccination coverage for eradication. They emphasize the importance of long-term follow-up studies to detect waning vaccine-induced protection and distinguish between various types of imperfections in clinical trials.
